billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Expands definition of place of public accommodation
summary: Prohibits discrimination because of race, creed, sex, color or national origin in institutions, clubs or places of public accommodation that are granted licenses or tax exemption from the state or any of its political subdivisions; clarifies the definition of "distinctly private" so that an institution which receives tax exemption or licensing from government, which are public privileges rather than private rights, may no longer discriminate on the basis of race, creed, sex, color or national origin.

    1  structures occupied by two or more tenants, or by the owner and  one  or
    2  more  tenants;  INSTITUTIONS, CLUBS OR PLACES OF ACCOMMODATION WHICH ARE
    3  LICENSED BY THE STATE OR ANY OF ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, OR  ARE  THE
    4  RECIPIENTS OF ANY FORM OF ABATEMENT OR EXEMPTION FROM TAXES, IN WHOLE OR
    5  IN PART, FROM THE STATE OR ANY OF ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS.  Such term
    6  shall not include public libraries, kindergartens, primary and secondary
    7  schools,  high  schools, academies, colleges and universities, extension
    8  courses, and all educational institutions under the supervision  of  the
    9  regents of the state of New York; any such public library, kindergarten,
   10  primary and secondary school, academy, college, university, professional
   11  school, extension course or other education facility, supported in whole
   12  or in part by public funds or by contributions solicited from the gener-
   13  al  public;  or  any  institution,  club or place of accommodation which
   14  proves that it is in its nature distinctly private. In no event shall an
   15  institution, club or place of accommodation be considered in its  nature
   16  distinctly  private  if  it  has more than one hundred members, provides
   17  regular meal service and regularly receives payment for dues, fees,  use
   18  of space, facilities, services, meals or beverages directly or indirect-
   19  ly  from  or  on  behalf  of a nonmember for the furtherance of trade or
   20  business. An institution, club, or place of accommodation which  is  not
   21  deemed  distinctly private pursuant to this subdivision may nevertheless
   22  apply such selective criteria as it chooses in the use  of  its  facili-
   23  ties,  in evaluating applicants for membership and in the conduct of its
   24  activities, so long as such selective criteria do not constitute discri-
   25  minatory practices under this article or any other provision of law. For
   26  the purposes of this  section,  a  corporation  incorporated  under  the
   27  benevolent  orders  law  or  described  in the benevolent orders law but
   28  formed under any other law of this  state  or  a  religious  corporation
   29  incorporated  under  the education law or the religious corporations law
   30  shall be deemed to be in  its  nature  distinctly  private  AND  IS  NOT
   31  LICENSED  BY  THE  STATE OR ANY OF ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS AND IS NOT
   32  THE RECIPIENT OF ANY FORM OF ABATEMENT OR EXEMPTION FROM TAXES, IN WHOLE
   33  OR IN PART, FROM THE STATE OR ANY OF ITS POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS.
   34    No institution, club, organization or  place  of  accommodation  which
   35  sponsors or conducts any amateur athletic contest or sparring exhibition
   36  and  advertises  or bills such contest or exhibition as a New York state
   37  championship contest or uses the words "New York state" in its announce-
   38  ments shall be deemed a private exhibition within the  meaning  of  this
   39  section.
